body.p: Paragraph D6 of the IFRS refers to revaluations that are broadly comparable to fair value or reflect an index applied to a cost that is broadly comparable to cost determined in accordance with IFRSs. It may not always be clear whether a previous revaluation was intended as a measure of fair value or differs materially from fair value. The flexibility in this area permits a cost‑effective solution for the unique problem of transition to IFRSs. It allows a first‑time adopter to establish a deemed cost using a measurement that is already available and is a reasonable starting point for a cost‑based measurement.
